comments.body: got the same idea but mine had luna moths, crayfish, mica, mud, and giant crayfish.
Polished limestone is just marble
What about limestone cliffs/mountains?
Stalactites and stalagmites should grow only in these caves. Because it's bizarre to see them on regular stone, they don't fit, it's almost if someone stuck them to the ceiling and the floor…

You shouldn't need silk touch, it is easy to break, but i believe it's structure is uniform enough that it wouldn't just crumble. It should probably form like granite, andesite, or diorite, but more common, and in larger amounts. probably about half to 70% of the stone would be lime from about 35 to 55.

Along with limestone, marble should be added. Limestone could be smelted into marble, and marble could be smelted again to get calcite. This recipe makes sense because calcite crystals form in limestone subjected to high temperatures. Limestone and marble would be great for building and terraforming. They could also be used in an update to the underground, such as limestone caves with patches of calcite and marble. Pointed limestone could also be found in the limestone caves, along with lichen, dripleaf, glow vines, and vines, or perhaps a new plant.

Limestone bricks would be a good idea too. Trying to build a French Chateau/European building just doesn’t look right with regular stone/stone bricks, sandstone is too light, stripped wood is wood not stone, and end stone is too yellow. Slabs, stairs, and wall variants would be nice too

I definitely would like to see some more fossils, especially those belonging to dinosaurs. The various fossils that exist in the game are just fragments of a giant humanoid skeleton, which is really disappointing me.

Cobble Stone Golems (crafted with 3 cobble stone blocks, soul crystal and carved pumpkin) could be cheap but are slow and die quickly

Stone Golems (crafted with 3 stone blocks, soul crystal and carved pumpkin) are slow but last longer since once they die they turn into Cobble Stone Golems

Scarecrow Golems (crafted with an armor stand, carved pumpkin and soul crystal) could be archers but only have four hearts.

Gold Golems (crafted with 3 gold blocks, soul crystal and a carved pumpkin) could be the must have of golem infantry, this way we can give gold more use, these would also be the main type of golems that cities would have.

You could give them the tools and armor they need.

Also

Implement a system where if you're seen stealing items or taking blocks from the city your reputation with the city decreases and it can decrease to a point where they will become hostile to you with the golems attacking you on sight, if you kill them the city will just slowly start to make stronger and stronger golems till you're out of their city or die, if you still want to bother and terrorize the city you could sneak during night so long as the golems don't see you.

If you do good deeds like killing mobs near or in the city or add in more blocks (to encourage players to build stuff for cities) your reputation with the city could increase to the point where they could gift you things such as Soul Crystals to make your own golems, or you could trade with the villagers.

In particular, I would like for there to be a 3x3 drawbridge (3×3×0.5 slab) that works pretty much like a trap door (hinged), only requires a lever or button like an iron door. Also perhaps with decorative chains when in the lowered position.

Supposedly the first drawbridge was made at Quban fortress in ancient Egypt around 2000 BCE, thus it would be historically acceptable.

Also, a 3x3 portcullis (takes up a space 6x3x1), with an opened and closed position, also controlled by a switch or lever. I know you can make them with redstone and pistons, but having a default craftable portcullis (and drawbridge) would be convenient, especially for newer players. Perhaps two versions, a wooden and metal version. Also, the portcullis is historically accurate, as they were apparently invented by the Romans ~200 BCE.

Both items would be unstakable (because they are rather large), or limited to a number less than 64 at least.

I don't know, would 3x3 allow a person on horseback to pass through? Maybe 3x4 or 4x4 instead?

I thought about trying to create said drawbridge and portcullis by reverse engineering the door and trapdoor, but the way they are implemented it's beyond my JSON programming knowhow.

You should make coastal redwoods to

They can be up to 11 blocks wide and 83 blocks tall in real life; that's the size of General Sherman.

Coastal redwoods have been rejected :( But they haven't suggested Sequoias, so this could still be added (Hopefully?)

Here is how I would have them work: They are made of sequoia wood, and it takes a long time to mine, even with a netherite axe. (This is based on real life) The wood does not burn. The cones can fall naturally, and only turn into saplings when set on fire. They grow slowly, like real life, gradually taking longer before growing again. They will grow to a 1 x 1 tree in 3 daynight cycles, then 2 x 2 in an additional 5, 3 x 3 in 7, 4 x 4 in 9, 5 x 5 in 11, 6 x 6 in 13, 7 x 7 in 15, 8 x 8 in 17, 9 x 9 in 19, 10 x 10 in 21, 11 x 11 in 23, and then they will not grow anymore, meaning a full-sized tree takes 143 days to become that way. They will also increase height. Giant sequoias do not have vines dangling down. You can decide where a sequoia will grow by adding more saplings, in up to an 11 x 11 space, and when they grow they will turn to full size immediately. However, getting cones is risky. If you mine a sequoia wood, it has a chance to get you nothing, and you will get the achievement "greedy logger", as sequoias should not be chopped down. Sequoia groves spawn as a taiga or snowy taiga variant, with spruce and sequoia trees. You can bonemeal saplings, but not cones, and you cannot bonemeal full trees. If you blow up a sequoia with TNT, it will drop nothing.

Realistically the Sequoia trees should be wider- between 5-13 blocks in diameter. They also should be up to 100 blocks tall. The cones (or saplings) should also take a very long time to grow, or not be able to be grown at all. In addition, why not add Coast Redwoods? These trees would be thinner in diameter (3-7 blocks) but extremely tall (to 130 blocks). Both Redwoods and Sequoias should have new wood and leaves.

7034229440781 13 meters is about the absolute biggest a sequoia can get. Also, coastal redwoods were rejected. :(

The possibilities are endless!

I am terribly sorry, but I have to disagree.  I personally believe that the Youtube channel The Game Theorists was right with this theory in the video, "The Forgotten War of Minecraft".  While I think it would be awesome to get a new dimension like a continuation of the Deep Dark, I agree that the disk that came with this update should be viewed as a warning of what is on the other side of that portal.  Remember that the skulk wasn't always around.  It is possible that the Warden and Skulk came from this other dimension.  Although that would be an incredible April Fools update.
i want to open this portal
This is a cool idea
Sounds like a good idea but what happens if there in creative?

If we're trying to have more dimensions that the portal would lead you through (which I think would be the best purpose for a portal) we already have a floating block void world: The End. We already have a boxed-in roofed world: The Nether. What if the portal took us through an infested dimension of our overworld? The moment you repair the portal and go through, it copies your overworld but makes it infested. Like our structures are cursed and there are cursed mobs or mixed mobs. Ex: skeleton and spider rider become morphed arachnecentaurs, etc. I don't want to copy a genre like Stranger things, but it is an awesome idea. Mojang could even canonize Herobrine as the big mob of that dimension.

it should have to do with the red stone underneath the portal

A simple kill the Warden, get a key, open a new dimension would be fun, but it would feel too familiar. We already have that loop with the Nether and the End. The Deep Dark feels set up for something more unsettling than just another boss gate
One of the strongest theories is that reinforced deepslate isn’t a portal frame, it’s a seal.
Sculk behaves less like a natural biome and more like bio-engineered technology: it reacts to sound, spreads from death, stores souls, and transmits signals. Even the mob guarding it isn’t called a boss ,it’s literally a Warden. That alone suggests containment, not treasure protection
The Ancient Cities feel more like fallen containment facilities than dungeons. The “portal” looks like a breach that was sealed after something went wrong
Imagine needing something truly dark and powerful to crack that seal and when you do, you don’t step into a new dimension.
A major boss is unleashed, Wardens begin spawning as the fight grows louder, and the battle becomes chaotic and terrifying. The boss could be massive or swarm-based — something that finally explains where sculk came from and ties the Deep Dark, the End, and the Nether together
After defeating it, instead of gaining permanent access like the Ender Dragon, you’re given the ability to re-seal the breach, unlocking the knowledge to craft reinforced deepslate yourself
My two pennies: not just a new dimension,
but a containment breach, a world-level threat, and the choice to seal it again.
Nether fortress. Wither. Curse of Binding and Curse of Vanishing.  All already been added.

I get that furniture is on Mojang's "no-no-list" for feedback; however, chairs should have been an exception to this. The claim that it stifles creativity isn't true. You give me a basic wooden chair, that allows me to actually sit, and I will give you numerous builds utilizing it. Players have utilized minecarts and boats to get close to this, but it falls short and people dislike it. It's to the point where it is just annoying that being able to SIT isn't allowed. Yes, you can build "chairs"; they're not usable though. Creativity can be present in an items use as well, not just the item. Which is why not having a simple wooden chair is stifling people's creativity. Four legs, a back, and a seat; this is all that it needs to be...nothing more. Do this with each piece of wood, and the community will build. If you think of everyday objects that you use, a chair is high on the list.
